definition: to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: Her feelings of affection are dormant but easily awakened.
sentences.chinese: 她的钟爱之情蛰伏着但很容易被唤醒。

sentences.english: It is the dreamthat wakes within us all.
sentences.chinese: 是这样的梦想将我们所有人唤醒。

sentences.english: If the person next to you is asleep, gently wake him or her up.
sentences.chinese: 如果你身边的人睡着了，轻轻地把他或她唤醒。

sentences.english: The bark of the muntjac was believed to waken the sun.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信山羌的吠叫声可以唤醒太阳。

sentences.english: Touched, was infiltrating mind days better life, is to awaken the zen sound.
sentences.chinese: 打动，是浸润心灵的天簌，是唤醒生命的禅音。

sentences.english: You wake me up, from profound coma and aimlessness.
sentences.chinese: 是你，将我从深深的混沌与迷惘中唤醒。

sentences.english: The sound roused Nikol from her dread lethargy.
sentences.chinese: 这个声音唤醒了无精打采的妮可。

sentences.english: Ou Ning introducing the only sound art project: Awakening Battersea.
sentences.chinese: 我介绍本次展览唯一的声音项目《唤醒巴特西》。

sentences.english: To ensure that every guest that requests a wakeup call, receives it.
sentences.chinese: 确保所有有需要有唤醒服务的客人接到电话。

sentences.english: Atlas: I have woken the torment of the underworld, vanished to the darkest pit of Hades .
sentences.chinese: 我唤醒了地狱中的痛苦，在冥王最黑暗的深渊中隐去。

sentences.english: To develop sati is to shake the knowing element of a person.
sentences.chinese: 培养觉性就是在唤醒一个人的觉知元素。

sentences.english: Passengers can also rent day rooms with a kitchen and wake-up call service.
sentences.chinese: 乘客还可以租到带厨房和唤醒服务的房间。

sentences.english: It was like a slap in the face - a wake up call.
sentences.chinese: 它就像是在我脸上闪了一巴掌似的唤醒了我。

sentences.english: I was aroused from my deep sleep by a loud scream.
sentences.chinese: 一声尖叫把我从熟睡中唤醒。

sentences.english: Sound the ship's general alarm to rouse all crew.
sentences.chinese: 发全船紧急警报唤醒船员。

sentences.english: It was Einstein's thoughts on human rights and democracy that awakened me.
sentences.chinese: 是爱因斯坦的人权和民主思想唤醒了我。

definition: to waken (to action)/to rouse (the masses)/to evoke (attention, recollection etc)
to be fast asleep/(fig.) to lie dormant/to lie undiscovered
to come to/to awaken/to regain consciousness
to call out (a name etc)/to shout
to awaken/to come to realize/awakened to the truth/the truth dawns upon one/scales fall from the eyes/to become aware
in the depth of one's soul
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
